Description of problem:
The grilo-package ships /usr/share/grilo-0.2/plugins but does not own /usr/share/grilo-0.2
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): grilo-0.2.11-1.fc21
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. yum install grilo 2. rpm -qf /usr/share/grilo-0.2
Actual results: # rpm -qf /usr/share/grilo-0.2 file /usr/share/grilo-0.2 is not owned by any package
Expected results: The package to own /usr/share/grilo-0.2
Additional info: The package grilo-plugins seems to install into /usr/share/grilo-plugins. Is this correct?

(In reply to Ralf Corsepius from comment #0)
Closer inspection of the source code seems to tell that grilo doesn't use /usr/share/grilo-0.2 at all. It internally seems to use %{_libdir}/grilo-0.2.
That said, I think /usr/share/grilo-0.2 should be removed.
